The Assignment Technical Focus â€¢ Utilize a shallow depth of field (f/2.8, 1/125s, ISO 200) in aperture priority mode to isolate flowers during spring. â€¢ Set your camera to manual mode with a shutter speed of 1/500s, aperture f/11, and ISO 100 to capture the vibrant colors of summer landscapes. â€¢ Use a polarizing filter to enhance autumn foliage colors while shooting at f/4, 1/250s, ISO 400. â€¢ In winter, experiment with long exposures (f/8, 15s, ISO 100) to create dreamy effects in snowy scenes. â€¢ Adjust white balance settings to 'Cloudy' to warm up the tones in your autumn photographs. Creative Focus â€¢ Capture the interplay of light and shadow during the golden hour to enhance the mood of your seasonal images. â€¢ Incorporate leading lines in your compositions to draw the viewer's eye through the scene. â€¢ Experiment with reflections in water during autumn to add depth and interest to your shots. â€¢ Create a series of images that showcase the transition between seasons, focusing on changes in color and texture. â€¢ Utilize negative space in winter photography to emphasize the stark beauty of a snow-covered landscape.
